intro: Valeriana tzotziliana, commonly known as the Tzotzil valerian, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, strong fragrance. Valeriana tzotziliana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
